intro: Gymnostachyum signatum, commonly known as the yellow sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with smooth, waxy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in the wild.
